statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \sin 4 x \cdot \sin 8 x

step.context: \text{The following substitution would convert}\\ \sin 4x\cdot\sin 8x \text{ to the more easily integrable}\\ \text{form } \sin \theta_1 + \sin \theta_2 \text{ or }\cos \theta_1 + \cos \theta_2
\text{If }I=\int\dfrac{1}{2}\cos 4x dx - \int\dfrac{1}{2}\cos 12x dx \\ \text{then does this look correct}?
step.reason: \int \cos (a x)dx = \dfrac{\sin (a x)}{a}+ C_1 \\ \text{where }C_1 \text{ is the constant of integration.}
